item.title: Paper Review: Green et al., (2022). LST/Tair, a remote sensing-based indicator of vegetation water stress
item.author: lht3718@gmail.com (Hoontaek Lee)
item.description: 23 April, 2022 (Green, gcb, lst_over_tair) Green, J. K., Ballantyne, A., Abramoff, R., Gentine, P., Makowski, D., & Ciais, P. (2022). Surface temperatures reveal the patterns of vegetation water stress and their environmental drivers across the tropical Americas. Global Change Biology, 28(9), 2940–2955. https://doi.org/10.1111/gcb.16139 Green et al. introduced the ratio of land surface temperature (LST; temperature of the top canopy) to air temperature as an indicator of vegetation water stress. I was particularly interested in their analysis using random forest and the Shapley value to quantify the effect (e.
item.dc:creator: Hoontaek Lee
